text:
Samajwadi Party on Monday claimed to have bagged 36 district Panchayat chairman posts unopposed, including one in Congress vice-president Rahul Gandhi’s constituency Amethi.

“Of the 74 districts, where elections for the post of district Panchayat Chairman are going on, the party has won unopposed in 36 districts, including Amethi. It’s a big success of the party,” SP spokesman Rajendra Chowdhury said.

Monday was the last day of withdrawal of nominations.

Elections are scheduled on January 7 following which the State Election Commission will declare the formal results.

SP candidates won unopposed in Amethi, Lalitpur and Sant Kabir Nagar after withdrawals.

In an embarrassment to the Congress, the party’s Amethi nominee for the post of Chairman of district Panchayat, Krishna Chaurasiya, withdrew her nomination paving way for the unopposed election of SP candidate.

Shiv Kali Maurya is the lone nominee left for the post of Zila Panchayat Chairman in Amethi after the withdrawal of nomination of Congress candidate Krishna Chaurasiya, District Magistrate of Amethi Jagatraj Tewari said.

There was a direct contest between the Congress and the Samajwadi Party for the post in Mr Gandhi’s constituency. Yogendra Misra, local unit president of the Congress, said that the party has nothing to do with the withdrawal of Ms Chaurasiya’s candidature and it was her personal decision.

“Had she contested, the party would have extended full support,” Mr Misra said.

“She has not taken party’s advice on withdrawing her candidature and it is her personal decision,” said Mr Gandhi’s representative Chandrakant Dubey who was present during the filing of nomination by Ms Chaurasiya. -- PTI
title: SP claims victory in district panchayat polls
